channel.title: Worlds and Synchronizing
channel.description:
ok i have been wondering if it is posible to have difernt worlds like on real rs? also i have tryed simply making short cuts and having servers on difernt ports but it didnt work and my server said it was because it couldnt write file... anyone know how to do this or help me on this?
heres some pics [img]http://img248.imageshack.us/img248/1695/59397782gi4.png[/img] [img]http://img523.imageshack.us/img523/3976/63338851ps3.png[/img] [img]http://img523.imageshack.us/img523/2246/60895099fe9.png[/img] [img]http://img523.imageshack.us/img523/2934/16710787ck6.png[/img]

item.title: Worlds and Synchronizing
item.dc:creator: @bakatool bakatool
item.description:
@bakatool wrote:

doesn’t matter each computer will handle the same load as one server running on it, I was talking about mapping the network with many computers or maybe mopar ppl hosting and all connecting to one central handler so everyone would be in one world.

You run 5 servers… each take 200 MB ram with 200 players?

you run 1 server with 1000 players it will take 1 GB… no changes u see?.. but running on different computers is totally different cuz cpu is used less stress on it

Read full topic

item.title: Worlds and Synchronizing
item.dc:creator: @elemenation_2 elemenation 2
item.description:
@elemenation_2 wrote:

cool so its posible do u think its doable? and also if your hosting 200 per port on a server on 5 ports how much ram would u need will 8 gigs do whats minimum?

Read full topic

item.title: Worlds and Synchronizing
item.dc:creator: @bakatool bakatool
item.description:
@bakatool wrote:

you would have to make a global npc server listening on some port all sub-servers will connect to it to get the cached npc’s in area and movements maybe keep a persistent connection with all servers so when a npc dies/moves all subservers (world’s) would update all clients connected to each world.

same for a playerHandler server which would be must harder to code than the npc server since the npc server is locally obtainable info but playerHandler server would require every world to give it updates so others would keep sync.

I like this idea because it would bring alot of players online at once to private server community than 20 per server -.- … but dunno might lag.

Read full topic

item.title: Worlds and Synchronizing
item.dc:creator: @newservermaker newservermaker
item.description:
@newservermaker wrote:

it isnt completly possible like rs2 for private servers yet, well it is, but it isnt discuvered. You can make you server on 2 ports then make one load from the other though, that is that closest we have goten to “worlds”, there is a tutorial how to do what i say at http://www.dodian.com

Read full topic

item.title: Worlds and Synchronizing
item.dc:creator: @elemenation_2 elemenation 2
item.description:
@elemenation_2 wrote:

cool u want in? cause i got the idea when thinking about having like 2000 peps in 5 worlds… 10000 peps but also weed need a webclient to make the worlds simpler and yes it would have to stay in sync[br][size=1]Posted on: November 04, 2007, 11:07:14 PM[/size][hr]shout hate to double post but i answering 2 dif things…

you wouldnt need 2 difernt computers just one realy good one with lots of ram also there could be a website that loaded 5 difernt clients that are the same but difernt ports…

Read full topic

item.title: Worlds and Synchronizing
item.dc:creator: @bakatool bakatool
item.description:
@bakatool wrote:

it is possible if you are saying have different servers on different ports even ip’s hosted and all players would connect to one big world, will require heavy traffic to keep possible of all actions and movements in sync, wouldn’t be a problem if all servers were hosted on the same network though could be really cool project…

Read full topic
